<site xmlns="com-wordpress:feed-additions:1">121696053</site>
		<item>
		<title>Nike’s Air VaporMax Triple Black will be making a return this month</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/nikes-air-vapormax-triple-black-will-making-return-month/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 01 Jun 2017 20:11:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=1027</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The highly sought out Nike Triple Black Air Vapormax will being returning this coming month (June). The VaporMax trainer made its debut during the Nike Air Max Day celebrations with the black colourway becoming very popular with Air Max fans and sneakerheads across the world. The reception was so good that Nike had decided to bring it back! Sporting a knitted upper and the signature bubble cushioning system covering the entire outsole in a tinted finish, specks of dark grey are applied along the toe cap, tongue and collar section for a touch of contrast, while finishing details include synthetic accents on the heel and Swooshes. A trainer of comfort.

On June 20th you can go and cop the Nike Air Vapormax Triple Black at select retailers, check our Instagram page for updates.

<img class="alignnone wp-image-1023" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/Nike-Air-Vapormax-Flyknit-Black-03-300x169.png" alt="" width="651" height="367" />]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title>PLACES + FACES ANNOUNCE NEW MIXTAPE &amp; DROP A SICK FIRST SINGLE</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/places-faces-announce-new-mixtape-drop-sick-first-single/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 01 Jun 2017 20:42:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=1034</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Lifestyle brand Places + Faces have teamed up with Red Bull Music Studios to create and release a brand new mixtape.
It features some of the best of the sounds of the London underground, with appearances from artists such as 67, Kojey Radical, Scrufizzer and many more.
To celebrate the announcement, they have given us the first taste of the project and what is to come, an explosive new banger called "What's Next?". It features an insane instrumental you can rock your head to from Kelvin Krash, while Daniel OG, Benny Mails, Cravemoore, Kasien, Danny Seth and Scrufizzer slap down their verses.

We'll definitely be adding this to our upcoming soundcloud playlist!

<strong>Listen to "What's Next" from Places + Faces by clicking the link below now and stay on the look out for the mixtape coming soon.</strong>

https://soundcloud.com/placesplusfaces/kelvin-krash-whats-next-ft-benny-mails-crave-moore-kasien-danny-seth-scrufizzer

<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-1035" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/CjevRJoWkAYvdL5-300x294.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="294" />]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Raf Simons x adidas Originals FW17 collaboration</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/raf-simons-x-adidas-originals-fw17-collaboration/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 03 Jun 2017 13:54:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=1058</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h5><span style="color: #000000;">A TEASER FOR THE RAF SIMONS X ADIDAS ORIGINALS FW17 COLLABORATION</span></h5>
<span style="color: #000000;">Raf Simons and adidas originals team up once again for FW17, with a few models which may seem familiar and exciting colourways. With loads of new releases  this season already, retailers and designers are already looking ahead, with the Ozeweego, Stan Smith and a few New Runners. The first pair appears to be arriving in red/black and white/black/gold, with complex iterations and on the high fashion silhouette. The two runners harness similar tones, as they also will be dropping in black/red and a lighter white/khaki combo. A more simplistic, minimalist approach is applied to the low tennis show, featuring a classic combination of Ftwr White and Core Black used at the heel. For a series of unannounced prices, you can expect these trainers to hit retailers like END real soon.</span>
<figure><img src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/http-2F2Fhypebeast.com2Fimage2F20172F052Fraf-simons-adidas-2017-fall-winter-1.jpg" alt="http-2F2Fhypebeast.com2Fimage2F20172F052Fraf-simons-adidas-2017-fall-winter-1" /></figure>
<figure><img src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/http-2F2Fhypebeast.com2Fimage2F20172F052Fraf-simons-adidas-2017-fall-winter-2-1.jpg" alt="http-2F2Fhypebeast.com2Fimage2F20172F052Fraf-simons-adidas-2017-fall-winter-2" /></figure>
<figure><img src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/http-2F2Fhypebeast.com2Fimage2F20172F052Fraf-simons-adidas-2017-fall-winter-3.jpg" alt="http-2F2Fhypebeast.com2Fimage2F20172F052Fraf-simons-adidas-2017-fall-winter-3" /></figure>
<figure><img src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/http-2F2Fhypebeast.com2Fimage2F20172F052Fraf-simons-adidas-2017-fall-winter-5.jpg" alt="http-2F2Fhypebeast.com2Fimage2F20172F052Fraf-simons-adidas-2017-fall-winter-5" /></figure>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Culture Manipulation – Grime Fashion SS17</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/culture-manipulation-grime-fashion-ss17/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 06 Jun 2017 00:49:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[altxuqi]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=1077</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h2><strong>Is our society continuing to adapt to the grime culture? </strong></h2>
Concluding my two part introduction on Grime, it is clear to see that not only has the music of the UK manipulated the streets of Britain, but it has had an huge impact financially and more importantly fashionably.

When observing the fashion of the uk aesthetically, it is overpowered by the casual streetwear often seen on most individuals, promoted online and within the streets. Specifically to grime – the Urban Spring/Summer 17 fashion is pervaded by Nike garms, Independent labels and ‘Graphic tees’.
<h4><span style="font-size: 14pt;">2015 was the year that brands finally started to realise the importance behind the cultural shift the scene had on the country and therefore started stocking clothing that nonetheless portrayed Grime and Artists involved.</span></h4>
<h2><strong><a href="http://www2.hm.com/">H&amp;M</a></strong></h2>
The Swedish multinational <b>clothing</b>-retail company, known for its fast-fashion <b>clothing for all genders </b>was one of the first commercial companies to follow the hype of Grime.  Clothing that words “GRIME” is being sold nationally within their stores. <em>Was this simply to be on trend with society or was this a money grabbing opportunity the company knew would be popular to stock?</em>

<img class="alignnone wp-image-140" src="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0319.jpg?w=330&amp;h=440" sizes="(max-width: 330px) 100vw, 330px" srcset="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0319.jpg?w=330&amp;h=440 330w, https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0319.jpg?w=660&amp;h=880 660w, https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0319.jpg?w=113&amp;h=150 113w, https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0319.jpg?w=225&amp;h=300 225w" alt="IMG_0319" width="330" height="440" data-attachment-id="140" data-permalink="https://altxuqi.wordpress.com/2017/06/05/culture-manipulation-grime-fashion-ss17/img_0319/" data-orig-file="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0319.jpg?w=330&amp;h=440" data-orig-size="1536,2048" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}" data-image-title="IMG_0319" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0319.jpg?w=330&amp;h=440?w=225" data-large-file="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0319.jpg?w=330&amp;h=440?w=768" />
<h2><strong>Independent labels: Grime Tees, Pink__UZI and HOMAGE tees.</strong></h2>
On the subject of stocking clothing that appeals to all, independent labels that are often promoted on the sites of social media are huge growing, selling their custom garms worldwide.

An example of Instagram retailers are <a href="http://instagram.com/homageteesuk">(@Homageteesuk)</a> and <a href="http://instagram.com/pink___uzi">(@Pink__uzi) </a>providing the best quality of graphic T-shirts, now a fashion statement and a must-have for all wardrobes, consisting of Grime Lords of our time, JME and Skepta. These collage filled T-shirts have been a hit across the high street, with celebrities like Maya Jama and Gigi Hadid rocking similar designs.
<h5><strong>*(Images below portraying the clothing are both styled and photographed by myself)      </strong></h5>
<img class="wp-image-166 aligncenter" src="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0325-e1496623419300.jpeg?w=362&amp;h=561" sizes="(max-width: 362px) 100vw, 362px" srcset="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0325-e1496623419300.jpeg?w=362&amp;h=561 362w, https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0325-e1496623419300.jpeg?w=724&amp;h=1122 724w, https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0325-e1496623419300.jpeg?w=97&amp;h=150 97w, https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0325-e1496623419300.jpeg?w=194&amp;h=300 194w, https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0325-e1496623419300.jpeg?w=661&amp;h=1024 661w" alt="IMG_0325" width="362" height="561" data-attachment-id="166" data-permalink="https://altxuqi.wordpress.com/2017/06/05/culture-manipulation-grime-fashion-ss17/img_0325/" data-orig-file="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0325-e1496623419300.jpeg" data-orig-size="2098,3249" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="IMG_0325" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0325-e1496623419300.jpeg?w=194" data-large-file="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/img_0325-e1496623419300.jpeg?w=661" />

</div>
</div>
</div>
&nbsp;
<h2></h2>
<h2><strong>THE FACE OF BRANDS –</strong></h2>
Skepta is arguably one of the most known artists within the Grime scene, and not only has his music prospered over to the U.S.A and the rest of the world, so has his fashion sense. With the expected look of grime artists involving puffa coats and tracksuits, the music has landed a lucrative opportunity from well known brands like Levi’s and the Japanese luxury leisure brand Uniqlo.

Although this is a contrast to the streetwear often exhibited by Skepta, this shows that a clever alignment can surface the world and spread the importance of Grime through the art of fashion.

<em>Skepta</em> – the face of <a href="http://uniqlo.com/"><strong>UNIQLO</strong>.</a>

<img class="wp-image-222 alignleft" src="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/skepta1.jpg?w=270&amp;h=382" sizes="(max-width: 270px) 100vw, 270px" srcset="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/skepta1.jpg?w=270&amp;h=382 270w, https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/skepta1.jpg?w=106&amp;h=150 106w, https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/skepta1.jpg?w=212&amp;h=300 212w, https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/skepta1.jpg 318w" alt="skepta.jpg" width="270" height="382" data-attachment-id="222" data-permalink="https://altxuqi.wordpress.com/2017/06/05/culture-manipulation-grime-fashion-ss17/uniqlo_6sheet_5-v2-2/" data-orig-file="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/skepta1.jpg?w=270&amp;h=382" data-orig-size="318,450" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Uniqlo_6Sheet_5-V2&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="Uniqlo_6Sheet_5-V2" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/skepta1.jpg?w=270&amp;h=382?w=212" data-large-file="https://altxuqi.files.wordpress.com/2017/06/skepta1.jpg?w=270&amp;h=382?w=318" />

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

In previous times, if one was to dress grime it would mean they’d be up to no good and were judged. Now society has finally accepted the movement, is it right for those “culture vultures” to only dress alongside the genre because it’s on trend and is slowly taking over Britain?

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="font-size: 12pt;"><strong>Blog written by - <a class="mention" href="https://altxuqi.wordpress.com/mentions/altxuqi/"><span class="mentions-prefix">@</span>altxuqi</a> </strong></span>

<span style="font-size: 12pt;"><strong>Her contact details - altauqiamal@yahoo.co.uk ; Twitter and Instagram - <a class="mention" href="https://altxuqi.wordpress.com/mentions/altxuqi/"><span class="mentions-prefix">@</span>altxuqi</a> </strong></span>]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Short Guide to the General Election</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/short-guide-to-the-general-election/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 06 Jun 2017 17:48:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=1085</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[BOOM! Just like that, another general election is around the corner, with members of Parliament scattering around to gather support from citizens they’ve more than likely neglected for months, pleading tooth and nail why they should get their vote come June 8th. But it only seems like yesterday that we saw David Cameron elected with an outright majority, only to resign a year later after the live comedy show that was Brexit.

As the last election was held in 2015, many thought it would be a good while yet before leaflets started flying through the letterbox again like something out of Harry Potter. All because of Theresa May’s decision to hold a ‘snap election’, a move which sent shockwaves throughout the political spheres (not really, it was low key expected).

What’s left is a Prime Minister nobody elected and an election that carries grave consequences, but how has this all happened?

<strong>So what is a snap election?</strong>

<img class="size-medium wp-image-1090 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/tt-1-300x185.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="185" />

If the party in power chooses to hold an early election, they can do so provided the majority of parliament agree to it. Snap elections are quite rare, the last occurring in 1974, so you can imagine that only the old timers are likely to remember correct protocol for when these things happen. So why has Mrs May chosen to hold an election early? There are many reasons, but to establish the main points we need to take it back to around June 2016, the time of the European Union Referendum.

Following the vote to leave the EU, then Prime Minister David Cameron decided to call it quits, having lost the gamble to play with our EU status. Theresa May triumphed in a mildly contested Conservative leadership race, and in doing so automatically became the Prime Minister.

&nbsp;

<strong>The public did not vote for Theresa May as Prime Minister</strong>

<img class="size-medium wp-image-1088 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/ccm-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="200" />

Following the referendum result and her becoming the PM, Theresa May has had to completely change her tune from being pro-EU, to enforcing the rhetoric “Brexit means Brexit, and we will make a success of it”. Unfortunately so far, nothing has quite been as successful as any Brexiteer would have hoped for.

Anyway, skipping forward slightly in time and Theresa May triggered what you will have heard of many times by now, the infamous article 50. In the Lisbon Treaty, article 50 allows an EU member state to end its membership of the union. Article 50 outlines that, once triggered, the leaving state has two years to negotiate an exit deal, a deal that all other member states must agree to. Brexit cannot be stopped unless we ask for the decision to be reversed and if the other member states unanimously let us off the hook.

The UK triggered article 50 at the end of March 2017, setting in motion negotiation proceedings. However, because the political landscape has changed drastically since the last election, combined with the fact that the referendum was won by a very slim margin, Theresa May cannot confidently say that the terms she is negotiating for are 100% backed by the British people.

What she is seeking then is what’s known as a ‘mandate’. A mandate in political terms is essentially an official reason or request to do something. If you have a mandate to do something, you have the necessary authority. Whatever May and the Tories say in the press, she has called this election early so that she can have a solid mandate going in to the EU negotiations regarding Brexit.

&nbsp;

<strong>Okay now that the context is in place, how is this election actually shaping up?</strong>

<img class="size-medium wp-image-1089 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/cvn-1024x576-300x169.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="169" />

To put it bluntly, the Conservatives trounced Labour in the last election. Labour lost seats pretty much everywhere and none more blatantly than in Scotland, where their dominance for years was cut to a single sitting MP. Since the last election, Jeremy Corbyn has taken the reigns for Labour and has done little to firmly establish Labour as a realistic leading party. This has not been helped by Labour’s domestic fighting every other week and constant calls of ‘no confidence’ from backbench “<span style="text-decoration: line-through;">Wenger</span> Corbyn Out” campaigners.

No matter how badly Labour thought they’d done however, this was nothing compared to the Liberal Democrats. Part of the coalition government in 2010-15, the Lib Dems proved they weren’t really up to the task of standing with the big boys, crumbling in the spotlight whilst consistently doubling back on promises (have we ever really forgiven them for the tuition fees debacle?).

When the chance came around to demonstrate how badly they’d done the British public did not go easy on them, slashing the number of seats they held from 57 to eight. The massacre led to Nick Clegg labelling the results as a “cruel and punishing night” followed by a swift resignation as party leader.

This election therefore presents quite an opportunity for the Conservatives; kick Labour whilst they’re down and squish the Liberal Democrats like the wounded bees they are.

&nbsp;

<strong>So what is each party offering this time?</strong>

The deadline for registering to vote has now closed. If you were sensible and have registered to vote, you will now want to check out the relevant party’s manifestos. Manifestos can be extremely lengthy, so if you’re short of time I would advise checking out summary versions online (most good broadsheet newspapers will have easily available summaries on their websites).

Below are key points from the Labour and Conservative manifestos.

&nbsp;

<strong><em>Education</em></strong>

<em>Tories:</em><em> </em>Increase funding for schools by £4bn by scrapping free school meals for children in their first three years of primary school, replacing it with free breakfasts. Build at least a hundred new free schools a year with councils banned from creating new places at schools rated inadequate or requires improvement. Lift the ban on selective schools. Ask universities and independent schools to help run state schools. Every 11-year-old expected to know their times tables off by heart, and a specialist maths school to be opened in every major city in England due to new funding arrangements.

<em>Labour:</em><em> </em>Abolish tuition fees and reintroduce maintenance grants for university students. Inject an extra £25.3bn into the education system, funded from extra tax revenue from the highest % of earners. Limit class sizes to 30 pupils for all five, six and seven year olds and to bring in free school meals for all primary pupils, using money raised by removing VAT exemption on fee-paying schools.

<em>Lib Dem:</em><em> </em>Invest £7bn extra in to the education system. Oppose new selective schools and give local authorities control over admissions and new schools. Reform Ofsted inspections. Guarantee all state school teachers are fully qualified or working towards qualification from Jan 2019. Tackle unnecessary teacher workloads. Reinstate university maintenance grants.

<strong><em> </em></strong>

<strong><em>NHS</em></strong>

<em>Tories:</em><em> </em>“Real terms” increases in NHS spending reaching £8bn extra per year by 2022/23. Retain the 95% four hour A&amp;E target. Require foreign workers and overseas students to pay more to cover the cost of NHS care.

<em>Labour:</em><em> </em>Scrap NHS pay cap. Inject £30bn in extra funding over the next five years. End hospital car parking charges. Secure budgets for mental health and ensure all children in secondary schools have access to a counselling service.

<em>Lib Dem:</em><em> </em>End the public sector pay freeze for NHS workers. Reinstate student nurse bursaries. Produce a national workforce strategy to prevent shortage of GPs, doctors and other NHS staff. Increase access to mental health talking therapies.

<strong><em>Brexit</em></strong>

<em>Tories:</em><em> </em>Leave the European single market and customs union, and instead seek a “deep and special partnership” including free trade agreements. Convert EU law into UK law and later allow parliament to pass legislation to amend and repeal these. Reduce and control immigration from Europe after Brexit. Remain signatories to the European Convention on Human Rights for the next parliament. Accept that ‘no deal’ is better than a bad deal

<em>Labour:</em><em> </em>Reject ‘no deal’ as a viable option and if needs be negotiate transitional arrangments “to avoid a cliff-edge for the UK economy”. Scrap Tories’ Brexit plan and replace with “fresh negotiating priorities” with strong emphasis on retaining benefits of single market access and customs union. Guarantee the rights of EU nationals living in the UK and work to “secure reciprocal rights” for UK citizens in the EU.

<em>Lib Dem:</em><em> </em>Initiate a second referendum on Brexit deal. Urge same rights for UK citzens living in EU countries. Protect the rights of people in Gibraltar. Retain membership of the single market and customs union.

<strong><em> </em></strong>

As you will no doubt know, politicians say a lot of stuff before election campaigns, so it is definitely in your best interests to take a slightly closer look at the areas that matter to you before making a decision. Whatever choice you make though, make sure it is an informed one. In the same time it will take you to clear you Snapchat stories, you could have read about what the parties plan to do about the national minimum wage. I urge you to be a good citizen and exercise your democratic rights come June 8<sup>th</sup>.

<strong>Conservative Party manifesto – </strong><a href="https://www.conservatives.com/manifesto">https://www.conservatives.com/manifesto</a>

<strong>Labour Party manifesto – </strong><a href="http://www.labour.org.uk/index.php/manifesto2017">http://www.labour.org.uk/index.php/manifesto2017</a>

<strong>Liberal Democrats manifesto – </strong><a href="http://www.libdems.org.uk/manifesto">http://www.libdems.org.uk/manifesto</a>

Written By – Bryon Grant

Instagram - <a href="https://www.instagram.com/byrxnho/">byrxnho</a>

Twitter - _ByronGrant

Check out his blog <a href="https://controversialone.wordpress.com/">https://controversialone.wordpress.com/</a>]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Balenciaga Shoes and Gvasalia&#039;s Impact</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/balenciaga-shoes-and-gvasalias-impact/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 10 Jun 2017 13:08:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=1127</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[“The master of us all”, <strong>Christian Dior</strong>.

Balenciaga is seen, in the eyes of many as one of the most luxurious brands in the modern-day due to its fine attention to detail and quality. Its demand has increased especially with the younger generation, especially with its remarkable shoe collection which is only getting better and better.

&nbsp;

<strong>The Shoes</strong>

<strong><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-1128" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/High-top-balecniaga-300x300.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="300" /></strong>

The Classics. Balenciaga's black sneakers are made from the same crinkled-leather that's seen on the house's iconic 'Arena' bags. This cool high-top pair has a padded ankle and is finished with glossy gold D-rings and guilloche hardware at the toe. Detail is everything!

<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-1129" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/balenciaga-with-sock-300x300.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="300" />

There has been a noticeable change since 2015 but Balenciaga was making heat long before Vetements’ designer Demna Gvasalia replaced Alexander Wang as the label’s head designer. This sock-like trainer channels the no-nonsense approach of similar sneakers from adidas and Nike, but ups the ante with a subtly branded upper and textured sole. The strong tech-ninja vibes are a plus. Personally, I see this as a huge step for Balenciaga in the modern market.

&nbsp;

<strong>Gvasalia’a Impact </strong>

Gvasalia has quickly become one of fashion’s most influential names, creating a raft of cult hits and inspiring thousands of copies. If you’ve noticed a rash of gothic script running down the arms of long-sleeved T-shirts or an abundance of oversized camel-coloured mackintoshes on the high street, Gvasalia is the source.

<img class=" wp-image-1130 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Gvasalia-300x219.jpg" alt="" width="363" height="265" />

From the beginning, Balenciaga sought to create a label synonymous with luxury. Vogue took notice, lauding the designer for his use of rich and sumptuous fabrics as well as the sense of grandeur his clothes portrayed. And – weird as it might seem – that is exactly what he has in common with Gvasalia. Despite the young designer’s fascination with “the ordinary”, his clothes are far from so. Demna Gvasalia has been outstanding at Implementing codes of power dressing with sophisticated cuts, he’s harkened back to his Georgian roots while still retaining the fashion house’s unshakable heritage.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1127</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-06-10 13:08:58]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-06-10 13:08:58]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[balenciaga-shoes-and-gvasalias-impact]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="fashion"><![CDATA[Fashion]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_page_template]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wpas_done_all]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_publicize_twitter_user]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[@CrepPlug]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wpas_skip_17490345]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wpas_skip_16538372]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_jetpack_related_posts_cache]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:1:{s:32:"37550b67d263a3ce789993dc25046c5f";a:2:{s:7:"expires";i:1587098067;s:7:"payload";a:6:{i:0;a:1:{s:2:"id";i:2747;}i:1;a:1:{s:2:"id";i:3722;}i:2;a:1:{s:2:"id";i:3102;}i:3;a:1:{s:2:"id";i:4583;}i:4;a:1:{s:2:"id";i:3775;}i:5;a:1:{s:2:"id";i:3900;}}}}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>THE RE-RELEASE OF THE YEEZY BOOST 350 V2 “ZEBRA” - 24TH JUNE</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/the-re-release-of-the-yeezy-boost-350-v2-zebra-24th-june/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 21 Jun 2017 12:15:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=2146</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="color: #000000;"><span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: -0.1px;">The adidas </span><a style="font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-size: 14px; border-width: initial; border-style: none; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; font-family: Arial; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: -0.1px;" href="https://sneakernews.com/tag/adidas-yeezy/">Yeezy Boost 350 V2 “Zebra”</a><span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: -0.1px;"> is officially restocking on June 24th, 2017. The shoes are currently live for reservations on the updated </span><a style="font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-size: 14px; border-width: initial; border-style: none; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; font-family: Arial; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: -0.1px;" href="https://sneakernews.com/2017/06/12/adidas-confirmed-app-update-june-2017/">adidas Confirmed App</a><span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: -0.1px;"> in Belgium, China, Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, The Netherlands, United Kingdom, and the United States. The Zebra Yeezys will also release at select retailers worldwide, and unlike the first release, this second drop will be much wider with higher quantity. Still, locking a pair in will prove to be difficult. Will this drive down the re-sale price of the Zebra Yeezys? Stay tuned for the full store list for the </span><a style="font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-size: 14px; border-width: initial; border-style: none; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; font-family: Arial; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: -0.1px;" href="https://sneakernews.com/tag/adidas-yeezy/">adidas Yeezy</a><span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: -0.1px;"> Zebra and let us know if these are a must-have for you.</span></span>

<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2148" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/zebra-yeezy-june-24-release-4-300x211.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="211" /> <img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2149" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/zebra-yeezy-june-24-release-3-300x211.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="211" /> <img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2150" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/zebra-yeezy-june-24-release-2-1-300x211.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="211" /><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2152" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/zebra-yeezy-june-24-release-6-300x211.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="211" />

					<item>
		<title>CREP PROTECT CLEANING SERVICE REVIEW: DID THEY SAVE MY SNEAKERS ?</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/crep-protect-cleaning-service-review-did-they-save-my-sneakers/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 21 Jun 2017 12:31:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=2154</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[So if you don't already know, Crep Protect is a product which repels liquids, preventing any stains spoiling your footwear and has an invisible coat. But does it really work? Our man Kickinitwiththeo has reviewed whether it does or not and here's the video review.

Check out the trainers he has up for sale on our website @kickinitwiththeo / @cxxlkickzbro, a great range of adidas trainers and some nikes !

<iframe width="1280" height="720" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IXU4kwZ2G1k?autoplay=1" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

FOR THOSE THAT DONT KNOW MY NEW SALMON (NOT PINK) SNEAKERS WAS MURDERED AT A BBQ. SO I DECIDED TO BRING THEM DOWN TO THE NEW CREP PROTECT X PRESENTED BY STORE TO TRY OUT THERE CLEANING SERVICE. A WEEK AND A HALF LATER AFTER THINKING THEY BOOKED ME FOR MY SNEAKERS IVE COLLECTED THEM. PRESS PLAY AND SEE HOW THEY SCRUBBED UP. I HOPE CREP PROTECT WAS ABLE TO SAVE THEM. GUESS THERE ONLY ONE WAY TO FIND OUT.

AS ALWAYS THANKS FOR THE LOVE AND SUPPORT, REMEMBER TO PRESS LIKE AND SUBSCRIBE AND TO FOLLOW US:

INSTAGRAM: KICKINITWITHTHEO
TWITTER: KICKINITWTHTHEO

YOU CAN FIND THE NEW CREP PROTECT X PRESENTED BY:
15 PERCY ST
LONDON
W1T 1DS]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title>VLONE RETURNING TO LONDON WITH ANOTHER POP-UP SHOP NEXT WEEK</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/vlone-returning-to-london-with-another-pop-up-shop-next-week/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 06 Jul 2017 23:49:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=2348</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="aligncenter wp-image-2350 size-full" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/VLonebari.jpg" alt="" width="1382" height="921" />

Fresh off the runway in Paris, VLONE is returning to London for another pop-up shop. Although details are limited at the moment, A$AP Bari posted a teaser image captioned: “London Pop Up Next Week”. The image features a reworked Flight Club soap bar graphic t-shirt which is reportedly being sold next week.

There is also a chance that the recent Air Force 1 collaboration from the S/S18 runway show will release. These new colour ways were recently released via Nike Paris as a quick strike.

Stay tuned in to <a href="http://pausemag.co.uk/">PAUSE</a> for updates on locations and dates.

Orignal Post - <a href="http://pausemag.co.uk/2017/07/vlone-is-returning-to-london-with-another-pop-up-shop/?utm_content=buffer665eb&amp;utm_medium=social&amp;utm_source=twitter.com&amp;utm_campaign=buffer">PAUSE</a>]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title>Crepe City Is Back This Weekend, Don’t Miss Out !</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/crepe-city-back-weekend-dont-miss/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 22 Jul 2017 21:49:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=2459</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Crepe City is back next week on the 29<sup>th</sup> of July 2017 and we’ll be there !

<img class="wp-image-2462 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/CREPE-CITY-PIC-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="954" height="636" />
<p style="background: white; margin: 0cm 0cm 15.0pt 0cm;"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: 'Arial',sans-serif; color: #333333;">Crepe City is a footwear festival that showcases leading street wear brands from across Europe and has become one of the world’s largest market of exclusive trainers. Crepe City started in London 2009 by two friends and have now become the UK's first event where all sneakerheads can meet up, socialise and trade in trainers.</span></p>
The event has grown over the past few years from a bar in Shoreditch to now filling up the expansive Truman Brewery. There is definitely something for everyone at Crepe City no doubt with an incredible variety available for all tastes. Theres the hype beast line-up of adidas Originals Yeezy’s and the latest Jordan releases are there to serve those with deep pockets, and for those with older, more refined tastes, there are plenty of obscure hidden gems available at great prices.

&nbsp;

<img class="wp-image-2465 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/n-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="732" height="488" />

There will be over 250 resellers from the UK and Europe, giving you access to over 10,000 pairs of rare, vintage and deadstock kicks.

Each year Crepe City has grown stronger, meaning more sneaker resellers setting up shop in the Old Truman Brewery halls, and with it’s ever-growing expansion this weekend will see an area dedicated to mainland European sellers. We hope to be setting up our own stall there by next year for you guys !

&nbsp;

Make sure you buy your ticket for Crepe City tickets are still available from £5, we’ll be there ourselves and you’ll be able to spot us easily in our Crepplug merch. We might even be recording a Vlog for you guys on the day if everything goes to plan but it will definitely be a great day you that you don't want to miss !

For more information visit the Crepe City <a style="font-style: inherit;" href="http://crepe-city.co.uk/"><strong>webpage</strong></a>.

<img class=" wp-image-2467 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/s-300x180.jpg" alt="" width="860" height="511" />]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title>Nike Air Max 97 August Return</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/nike-air-max-97-august-return/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 22 Jul 2017 21:48:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=2470</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="wp-image-2471 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/nike-air-max-97-2017-release-dates-300x211.jpg" alt="" width="948" height="667" />

The return of the <strong>NIKE AIR MAX 97</strong> in three different styles marks one of the most exciting Air Max retros we’ve seen in recent years.

The Nike Air Max 97 was a neck-breaking release when it first dropped 20 years ago. Christian Tresser’s futuristic design was inspired by Japan’s high-speed Bullet trains, with contours and curves that gave the shoe a true feeling of speed and momentum. The original shoe looked great in any colourway, but the impact of the initial silver edition meant that metallic versions will always be highly coveted. The Air Max 97 is one of those rare models that people know and recognise immediately, no matter how its presented.

20 years after its original release, the ’97 continues to inspire. The relaunch of the Nike Air Max 97 OG sees it dropping in both black and white, whilst a special Nike Air Max 97 OG Premium edition accompanies it in some summer-friendly hues. Complementing the return of these two editions is the all-new Nike Air Max 97 Ultra, which reduces the silhouette’s weight and accentuates its signature lines in a single-layer upper – and introduces new Air-Sole PSI levels to provide a more comfortable journey. The hardest part will be selecting which of the eight colours to get…

The <strong>NIKE AIR MAX 97 OG</strong> is due to drop on <strong>TUESDAY 1 AUGUST</strong>. The <strong>NIKE AIR MAX 97 OG PREMIUM</strong> follows shortly afterwards on <strong>FRIDAY 4 AUGUST</strong> and, finally, the <strong>NIKE AIR MAX 97 ULTRA</strong> is due to arrive on <strong>THURSDAY 17 AUGUST</strong>.

<span style="font-size: 12pt;"><strong>FIND OUT WHERE YOU CAN BUY THEM HERE - https://www.thedropdate.com/ </strong></span>

<img class="alignnone wp-image-2475" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/aaaa-263x300.jpg" alt="" width="219" height="250" /> <img class="alignnone wp-image-2476" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/asdasd-258x300.jpg" alt="" width="219" height="255" /> <img class="alignnone wp-image-2477" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/ddd-253x300.jpg" alt="" width="209" height="248" />

<img class="wp-image-2483 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/nike-air-max-97-fall-2017-releases-300x211.jpg" alt="" width="653" height="459" />

Written By - <a href="https://www.thedropdate.com/">TheDropDate</a>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Carnival Nike Air Force 1s Are Coming Back !</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/carnival-nike-air-force-1s-coming-back/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 16 Aug 2017 16:07:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=2711</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Nike has built energy around the Air Force 1 in the past year by bringing back old styles and collaborating with brands such as Vlone and Comme Des Garcons, just to name a few. Nike are set to re-release two 'Carnival' pairs originally launched way back in 2003, connected to Brazil's carnival celebration.

<img class="alignnone wp-image-2712" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/carnival-nike-air-force-1-orange-flash-green-black-300x147.jpg" alt="" width="722" height="354" />

There hasn't been an official announcement from Nike around the shoes, although rumour has it they could be in stores for August 19th. However, if you are feeling particularly desperate for a pair and want to rock them to Notting Hill carnival (which is next week already), you could cop them on eBay. Otherwise keep your pockets ready to cop them fresh on the August 19th.

I guess you can't go wrong with a pair of Air Forces can you. Make sure if you need a pair to grab them from our store, and if you've got a pair you want to get rid of, sell them on our store !

And if you are going to Notting Hill carnival next weekend, enjoy it and stay safe.

&nbsp;

Source : <a href="https://solecollector.com/news/2017/08/carnival-nike-air-force-1-retro">Solecollector</a>]]></content:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Off-White™ x Nike Sneakers</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/off-white-x-nike-sneakers/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 21 Aug 2017 19:50:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=2747</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif;">Off-White™‘s collaboration with Nike has been in the pipe line for a while now and has become a very anticipated release from what was once a little rumor has now become a wide-ranging collection dropping real soon. Over the past few weeks, we’ve seen collaborative sneakers such as the Air Jordan 1, the Air Max 90 and the VaporMax. Now, images of every piece in the 10-shoe collection have been revealed, which also includes Air Max 97s, Blazers, and Converse’s Chuck Taylor All-Star.</span>

<span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif;">Abloh revealed the whole collection and also sat down with Nike’s Vice President of Footwear Andy Cain to talk some more about the  hyped collection. The interview also included official confirmation of the collaboration’s release date, with a series of pre-releases at NikeLab locations to tie in with corresponding fashion weeks. NikeLab New York Will begin with the first release, between September 9-13, while London from September 18-22, followed by Milan September 21-25 and Paris from September 26-30.</span>

<span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif;">The special edition “colorway” has already been gifted to a host of celebrities and creatives such as A$AP Rocky, Travis Scott, Ibn Jasper and Don C, who received personalized hand-drawn details on the midsoles by Abloh himself. These great pairs are remixed with features such as deconstructed accents, graphic overlays, an oversized Swoosh, blue and orange stitching, Off-White™ branding throughout, and various words in double quotation marks.</span>

<span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif;">While there’s no word on the official retail price, some sources have estimated a $350 USD pricetag on these crep. Stay tuned for more information and let us know if you’ll be copping in the comments below.</span>

<span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif;">Virgil Abloh has certainly solidified his credentials in streetwear and fashion. Abloh is regularly covered in <em style="font-weight: inherit;">Vogue</em>, and his fashion brand OFF-WHITE shows on the Parisian runway at fashion week, so a collaboration with <a style="font-style: inherit; font-weight: inherit;" href="http://www.nike.com/us/en_us/">Nike</a> is totally within reason considering the current streetwear climate.</span>

&nbsp;

<span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif;">Read some key quotes from Virgil as he discusses the collection, titled “The Ten: Icons Reconstructed by Virgil Abloh,” </span>

<span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif;"><strong>On the projects:</strong></span>
<span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif;"> “I always like a challenge. The idea of ‘The Ten’ is Nike going into its history and asking a designer such as myself to tell a story by highlighting a design detail and innovation within [each of the] ten models. What’s interesting is the scope of the project. It’s a hallmark, a very important idea of post-modern culture, innovation and athletic performance all intertwined into one.”</span>
<span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif;"> <strong>On the future of streetwear:</strong></span>
<span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif;"> “The future of streetwear is that it should no longer serve itself. This project is truly a democracy of how design explores the world. I’m interested in how the kid that’s standing outside his or her local Foot Locker or Nike Town buying Jordans and taking my ideas gets inspired and takes a marker to the shoes or attaches a red zip tie and now they’re part of the conversation.”</span>

&nbsp;

<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2751" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Virgil-Abloh-Nike-The10-4_original-244x300.jpg" alt="" width="244" height="300" />  <img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2752" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Virgil-Abloh-Nike-The10-6_original-244x300.jpg" alt="" width="244" height="300" /> <img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2753" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Virgil-Abloh-Nike-The10-8_original-1-241x300.jpg" alt="" width="241" height="300" />  <img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2765" style="font-size: 0.95em;" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Virgil-Abloh-Nike-The10-13_native_600-244x300.jpg" alt="" width="244" height="300" /><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2755" style="text-indent: 0em;" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Virgil-Abloh-Nike-The10-10_original-242x300.jpg" alt="" width="242" height="300" />  <img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2763" style="text-indent: 0em;" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Virgil-Abloh-Nike-The10-5_native_600-242x300.jpg" alt="" width="242" height="300" /> <img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2764" style="text-indent: 0em;" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Virgil-Abloh-Nike-The10-11_native_600-242x300.jpg" alt="" width="242" height="300" /> <span style="text-indent: 0em;"> </span><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2766" style="text-indent: 0em;" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Virgil-Abloh-Nike-The10-9_native_600-245x300.jpg" alt="" width="245" height="300" /> <img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2767" style="text-indent: 0em;" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Virgil-Abloh-Nike-The10-7_native_600-241x300.jpg" alt="" width="241" height="300" /> <span style="text-indent: 0em;"> </span><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2757" style="text-indent: 0em;" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Virgil-Abloh-Nike-The10-14_original-244x300.jpg" alt="" width="244" height="300" />

<strong>27 UK &amp; European accounts will release the Nike x Virgil Abloh 'The Ten" collection using a Raffle release system from Friday 27th October through to Saturday 4th of November. For specific information regarding entry, pricing, and collection please see <em><a href="https://www.thedropdate.com/releases/nike-x-virgil-abloh-the-ten-air-presto-air-max-90">here</a>.</em></strong>

<strong>Friday 27th October – Air Jordan 1 &amp; Blazer x Virgil Abloh</strong>
<strong>Sunday 29th October – Air Presto &amp; Air Max 90 x Virgil Abloh</strong>
<strong>Tuesday 31th October – Nike HyperDunk x Virgil Abloh</strong>
<strong>Saturday 2nd November – Nike Zoom VaporFly &amp; VaporMax x Virgil Abloh</strong>
<strong>Saturday 4th November – Air Force 1 &amp; Air Max 97 x Virgil Abloh</strong>

Which crep of Virgil’s do you prefer the most? Comment and let us know !

<strong>Sources :</strong>

<a href="https://news.nike.com/release_images/a155c2bc-8c3d-43bc-b47d-7941cdfee668">https://news.nike.com/release_images/a155c2bc-8c3d-43bc-b47d-7941cdfee668</a>

<a href="https://hypebeast.com/2017/8/off-white-nike-10-sneakers">https://hypebeast.com/2017/8/off-white-nike-10-sneakers</a>

<a href="https://news.nike.com/release_images/a155c2bc-8c3d-43bc-b47d-7941cdfee668">https://news.nike.com/release_images/a155c2bc-8c3d-43bc-b47d-7941cdfee668</a>

<a href="https://hypebeast.com/2017/8/off-white-nike-10-sneakers">https://hypebeast.com/2017/8/off-white-nike-10-sneakers</a>]]></content:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[YToyOntpOjA7czoxNDoiMTI5LjExLjEwNy4xNDciO2k6MTtzOjEzOiIxMDkuMjQ2LjQ4LjU5Ijt9]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_kksr_avg]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[5.00]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Skepta’s Nike Air Max 97 Collaboration</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/skeptas-nike-air-max-97-collaboration/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 22 Aug 2017 16:17:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=2790</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Another collaboration !

Skepta has been frequently spotted wearing Air Max TNs, while the Boys Better Know boss also released his own <a href="http://www.highsnobiety.com/2016/02/22/skepta-nike-air-max-bw/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">“Blacklisted” take on the Nike Air Max BW</a> in early 2016. Speaking on his love for the Air Max range, Skepta revealed to Nike; “I have been wearing Air Max for so long, since I was seven playing around in the estate; I feel like I know my Air Max well. Air Max is from when we were running the streets, it was comfortable to wear in London, whether you were going out to a club or kicking a ball in the streets. Those kinds of things stick in my mind from the young, magical, fantasy years of my life.”

<img class="alignnone wp-image-2793" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/skepta-nike-air-max-97-gallery-02-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="533" height="355" />  <img class="alignnone wp-image-2795" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/skepta-nike-air-max-97-gallery-01-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="528" height="352" />

&nbsp;

Now Skeppy is "doing it again", debuting his version of the sleek Air Max 97 for the it's 20th anniversary. The colourway derives inspiration from the colours, sounds and stories of Skepta’s home away from London, Morocco. Explaining his choice of design, Skepta notes “When designing the Air Max 97 Sk, we took the color palette of Morocco into consideration, but also the palette of the 1999 Air Tuned Max. That was the first shoe I ever saved up money to buy, so I wanted to bring its magic to the 97 — the magic that made me first love Air Max when I saw it as a child.”<img class="alignnone wp-image-2794" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: normal;" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/skepta-nike-air-max-97-gallery-04-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="543" height="362" /><img class="alignnone wp-image-2792" style="font-size: 1em;" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/skepta-nike-air-max-97-gallery-03-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="545" height="363" />

Skepta breaks down the colourway; “We added the embroidery inspired by Morocco, on the tongue and on the back, and created a print on the insole that is reminiscent of what I saw there, as well. The SK logo is in the shape of a British plug, and it’s mixed with the classic, small TN badges that they put on shoes.”

<img class="alignnone wp-image-2796" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/skepta-nike-air-max-97-ultra-release-date-300x200.jpeg" alt="" width="1280" height="853" />

The Nike Air Max 97 Sk is available globally starting September 2 on <a href="http://www.nike.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">nike.com</a> and at select retailers.

Will you be copping these? Let us know in the comments below !

&nbsp;

Source - High Snobiety]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Return of Nike Air Max 98&#039;s?</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/return-nike-air-max-98s/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 07 Sep 2017 12:51:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=2945</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[So we’ve seen everyone go mad for Air Max 97’s after it being their 20<sup>th</sup> anniversary and a whole range of releases in celebration, could next year be the same for Air Max 98’s?

Nike Air Max 98’s are likely to be back in stock real soon. The AM 98’s return would certainly be a good one. Other than a much-hyped collaboration with Supreme last year, Air Max 98’s haven’t been on the scene for a while.

Upon release, the Air Max 98 wasn’t received amazingly. Its stocky and in-your-face look was a big change from the more aerodynamic Air Max 97 that came the year previous. But nowadays with chunky/loaded crep in fashion, it’s the right time for its comeback. Stay tuned to find out more and be the first to be plugged in.

Would you cop or drop a re-release? Let us know in the comments.

Source – <a href="http://www.highsnobiety.com/2017/06/14/nike-air-max-98-reissue/">High Snobiety</a>

<img class="alignnone wp-image-2957" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/nike-air-max-98-obsidian-768x500-300x195.jpg" alt="" width="244" height="159" /><img class="alignnone wp-image-2958" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/supreme-nike-air-max-98-nikestore-release-03-300x210.jpg" alt="" width="223" height="156" /><img class="alignnone wp-image-2961" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Air-Max-98-White-Orange-Silver-8-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="233" height="155" />

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>NIKE AIR MAX 97 TNS !?</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/nike-air-max-97-tns/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 Oct 2017 23:36:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=3102</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="title header-color-change-point"><strong>Nike merges the Air Max 97 With the Plus TN Silhouette, a fusion of the two popular air maxes.</strong></p>
The last few months we have seen <a href="https://hypebeast.com/tags/nike">Nike</a> release a range of new <a href="https://hypebeast.com/tags/nike-air-max-97">Air Max 97</a> colorways, making it this years most popular pair. For its latest release of the silhouette, Nike has merged it with another of its classic trainers, the <a href="https://hypebeast.com/tags/nike-air-max-tn">Air Max TN</a> Plus.

The Air Max 97 Plus comes in a clean colorway, with a black 97 upper sitting on top of a white midsole taken from the TN silhouette.

At the moment, release details of this pair of crep are scarce, but the retail price is stated to be around £140 and they are due to drop at retailers including <a href="https://www.footpatrol.com/shop" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Footpatrol</a> in the coming weeks.

<img class="alignnone wp-image-3105" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/http-2F2Fhypebeast.com2Fimage2F20172F102FNike-Air-Max-97-TN-03-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="685" height="456" /> <img class="alignnone wp-image-3106" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/http-2F2Fhypebeast.com2Fimage2F20172F102FNike-Air-Max-97-TN-01-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="683" height="456" />

<strong>What do you guys think of this hybrid, would you cop?</strong>

<strong>Let us know below</strong>

Source : <a href="https://hypebeast.com/2017/10/nike-air-max-97-plus-tn">Hype Beast</a>]]></content:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_focuskw]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[nike]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_kksr_ips]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[YTo0OntpOjA7czoxMzoiODYuMTkuMjQ2LjE2MiI7aToxO3M6MTE6IjgyLjcuMjE1LjM1IjtpOjI7czozNzoiMjAwMTo2MzA6MzAxOjkxMTg6YTU3ZDpkNzViOjRiM2Q6NDIwNyI7aTozO3M6MTE6IjkxLjIyLjE2LjIxIjt9]]></wp:meta_value>

					<item>
		<title>OVO store is coming to London 😱</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/ovo-store-coming-london-%f0%9f%98%b1/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Nov 2017 02:11:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=3192</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>More money moves for Drake as usual, OVO is due to take over London</strong></p>
Drake might be setting up shop and opening the flagship OVO store in London after his famous owl logo has been branded across a shop front in the city.

As if it's not dangerous enough having the online store available 24/7, all of his exclusive merchandise will now be right on millions of people's doorstep.

<img class="size-medium wp-image-3198 alignleft" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Untitled-300x291.png" alt="" width="300" height="291" />

&nbsp;

Kanye West and Justin Bieber are just two of the many stars that have launched pop-up shops for their merch lines but Drake's decision to have a permanent store might influence others to do the same. He's already got flagship stores in New York, Toronto and Los Angeles, and Soho, London is the next location to feature Drake's very own clothing store.

The shop on 30 Berwick Street, London will sell his clothes and other merchandise with items for sale for the very affordable price range of between £32 and £110. No date has been announced for the opening yet, but it's very possible that shoppers might bump into Drake himself in the store.

&nbsp;

Reports that he may relocate to London temporarily to star in gangland drama <em>Topboy</em> have emerged after Ashley Walters told the <em>Mirror</em> that the show's producers are currently looking for a role for the Toronto rapper. Ever since he became close with <a href="http://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/article/skepta-konnichiwa-new-album">Skepta</a>, Drake's been going big on the London roadman vibes, from his love for BBK to his professed passion for the gritty series.

When the show was cancelled by Channel 4 back in 2013, Drizzy bought the rights, dropping hints about how he and Skepta were "making greatness" with their "creative direction" for the third season. But until now, we had no idea that Drake would actually be starring in it. “He loves acting, of course he wanted a part. He’s going to be really hands on and is getting stuck into it,” said Walters.

A shop in Soho, a role in a London drama and a whole load of British best friends. Drake is defo mandem now

&nbsp;

<img class="wp-image-3196 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/http_2F2Fhypebeast.com2Fimage2F20172F032Fdrake-on-road-00-300x169.jpg" alt="" width="767" height="432" />

&nbsp;

Besides making money via fashion, Drake is currently in the studio working on his fifth studio album after taking some well-deserved time off this summer.

Although Views<em> </em>was released in April of last year we haven't had a shortage of new Drizzy tunes thanks to his playlist-mixtape-album <em>More Life </em>that dropped back in March.

Maybe he can launch the new album with an instore concert

<img class="wp-image-3194 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/landscape-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="627" height="418" />

&nbsp;

Source : <a href="http://www.mtv.co.uk/drake/news/is-drake-opening-an-ovo-store-in-london#1XtOe55Qw8Jrw7lh.99">MTV</a>]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>The Changing Face Of Capitalism</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/changing-face-capitalism/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 04 Nov 2017 14:52:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=3206</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Wants are a funny old thing, human beings all have something they want. You, me, a pauper or a billionaire- despite our differences in race, income or education- all have common ground in one thing, we all "want" something. This forms the premises of what economists call the basic economic problem, to sum it up in no more than a few words- Human wants are infinite, but resources are scarce.
<div id="entry_paragraph_1" class="entry-body--paragraph-ad"></div>
"Scarcity" to me is the single most important word in economics and it forms the foundation of the discipline. Without scarcity, there would be no need for economics, whether that is a good or bad thing, I'll leave that to the reader's imagination.
<div id="entry_paragraph_2" class="entry-body--paragraph-ad"></div>
The late Paul Sampson, America's first Nobel Prize winner for economics is widely credited with providing the first clear and simple explanation of the economic problem- namely, that to solve the problem of scarcity all societies, no matter how big or small, developed or not, must endeavour to answer three basic questions. What to produce? How to produce? And for whom to produce? The debate on how to answer these three questions is one that rages on to this day, one that has brought about major moments in world history and radical changes -sometimes quite violently- to the political and socio-economic landscape.
<div id="entry_paragraph_3" class="entry-body--paragraph-ad"></div>
Capitalism, in the west at least, is the preferred economic system to answer Sampson's questions. This economic and political system based on the private ownership of trade and industry for profit rather than ownership by the state is acclaimed by many to be the most ideal solution to the basic economic problem. Undoubtedly since its emergence as the dominant system in western society, we have seen rapid increases in economic growth. Leading to the highest levels of prosperity humanity has ever experienced, but some would ask at what cost?
<div id="entry_paragraph_4" class="entry-body--paragraph-ad"></div>
Capitalism has many detractors, determined to overthrow the system for a fairer more equitable one. However, from the early origins of capitalism, we have seen something incredible. Heavy criticism of the system has led to a cultural shift; an evolution of sorts of capitalism.

&nbsp;

From the 16th century, Mercantilism was a significant economic force in Britain, where Merchants could amass huge fortunes from purchasing foreign goods cheaply and selling them at huge profits to markets where they are more expensive. Some would call this the earliest form of capitalism others, including myself, would disagree. It is a consensus amongst Marxists that capitalism derives the surplus value from labour. Late American Scholar and Marxist, Ellen Wood argued that commerce is not equivalent to capitalism and does not produce it because 'the dominant principle of trade everywhere was not surplus value derived from production but "profit on alienation", "buying cheap and selling dear" to word it more simply, although trade involves the seeking of profits, it does not in itself affect how goods are produced.

&nbsp;

The concept of wage work was a key development in the history of capitalism, The natural progression from mercantilism. At first, the merchants were a link between the consumer and producer. However, they gradually began to dominate the production process, first by placing orders and paying in advance, then by supplying the raw materials and paying a wage for the work done in producing finished goods. The first example of this in modern Britain was the cottage industry, where workers would carry out manufacturing activities in their homes, whilst production was directed by the capitalist. This was the default method of production in Britain's wool industry, which by the end of the 17th century became Britain's most profitable industry.

&nbsp;

The early 1770s saw the arrival of the industrial revolution. The ever-greater search for profits saw an evolution from the cottage industry to the manufacturing of goods in factories, which centralised production methods. For the capitalist further decreasing costs. As costs of production were at an all-time low, this led to Price deductions on British Exports which stimulated worldwide demand. This saw the British economy flourish. British exports rose from £15million in 1760 to £59million in 1805. However, the wealth was not seen by the workers who had made it possible but concentrated in the hand of those who owned the means of production and bought the labour of workers.

&nbsp;

Workers were often subject to terrible working conditions and long working hours but could not escape this as unlike in the cottage industry, a centralised production system means they are totally reliant on selling their labour for a wage.

&nbsp;

German Philosopher Karl Marx and English writer Charles Dickens were some of the most high-profile critiques of Capitalism amid the industrial revolution.

&nbsp;

Marx in the first volume of Marx capital tells us that workers are only partially remunerated for their labour expended in doing a job. The unremunerated portion is the source of surplus value and ultimately profits which are either ploughed back into capital accumulation or distributed as dividends to shareholders. According to Marx 'an endless dynamic process in which the extraction of surplus value depends upon the rate of exploitation. On the surface, the activities of the capitalist are reasonable and indeed rational, yet conceal a deeply unreasonable exploitation of human capacities and possibilities beneath the surface.' Reformers that sided with Marx were only further backed up by the visibly dreadful conditions of employment.

&nbsp;

In the early 20th century capitalism faced major threats to its status as the most dominant political system. The Russian revolution of 1917 saw the world's first socialist state, whilst the great depression of the 1930s saw critics of capitalism increase pressure for reform. By the end of the 2nd world war, the birth-place of Capitalism, Great Britain, due to her war efforts was in financial difficulties. Austrian-born American economist and political scientist, Joseph Schumpeter, one of the great intellectuals of the era- when posed the question "Can capitalism survive" in January 1936, He bluntly answered, "No, ladies and gentlemen it cannot." Schumpeter delved into the question again this time in his book, Capitalism, Socialism and Democracy, published in 1942 during the second world. His answer was again the same but justified at greater length.

&nbsp;

Not only did capitalism survive but capitalism thrived by absorbing the unrest and criticism, creating a new 'slicker' version of itself. The arrival of credit and the instalment plan created a new age of consumerism, giving capitalism the right conditions to once again reign supreme. Even the lowest on the social class ladder now had consumer aspirations. Slick marketing campaigns now meant you could now wear the same products as your favourite celebrity. If we look around in today's world we see the very people who capitalism disadvantages the most, further pushing the perpetual wheels of consumption. Take global shoe brand Nike- their ad campaigns are shot in tower block estates. appealing the most to a class who are amongst the lowest earning a class who should be amongst it's fiercest critics. Not to say that today capitalism has completely rid itself of its detractors. The chameleon-like ability to mask's its flaws may someday cause future generations of humanity to pay the ultimate price but the sheer adaptability of the system itself is one to marvel at.

&nbsp;

Author - <a href="https://twitter.com/imohekpo_"><em>Imoh Ekpo </em></a>

Business Economics and Finance student at Loughborough University.

Founder of JoeySpeaks LTD.

Co-Owner of Scenera LTD.]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title>Drake Teases Unreleased Timberland Boots</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/drake-teases-unreleased-timberland-boots/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Nov 2017 23:50:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=3220</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Yes another Drizzy post
<p data-reactid="131">Drake and popular outdoors wear company Timberland might have a collaboration cooking</p>
<p data-reactid="135">On Nov. 4, Drake posted a photo to his Instagram page displaying a handful of shoes, including a few pair of Jordans. But the footwear that stood out the most was a pair of wheat Timberland boots with the OVO emblem on the tongue. Drizzy left us thinking, putting up the photo without a caption, making it unclear if this is a collab that will be released to the masses or some personal sauce.</p>
<p data-reactid="136">This would be just another venture into the shoe world for the Canadian rap star. He has a strong relationship with the Jordan family<a href="http://www.xxlmag.com/lifestyle/2017/07/drake-best-footwear-moments/" data-reactid="138">,</a> which he famously rapped about on the Future duet, "Jumpman" off their joint album, <em data-reactid="141">What a Time to be Alive.</em></p>
<p data-reactid="144">Drake appears to have a bunch of songs waiting in the vault. A snippet of Drake and Quavo surfaced on the internet a couple weeks ago, unreleased music playing in an undisclosed venue, vocals from the two over a trap-heavy instrumental.</p>
<p data-reactid="144"></p>
<p data-reactid="160">Check out Drizzy's pair of OVO wheat Timbs below, let us know what you think of them</p>
<p data-reactid="160"><img class="alignnone  wp-image-3221" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/ss-300x199.png" alt="" width="1125" height="746" /></p>
<p data-reactid="160">Source : <a href="http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2017/11/drake-teases-timberland-collaboration/">XXLMAG</a></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>3220</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-07 23:50:58]]></wp:post_date>

					<item>
		<title>WIN A PAIR OF NIKE AIR MAX 97’S</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/win-pair-nike-air-max-97s/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 11 Nov 2017 11:55:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=3240</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: left;">So we are finally doing our first competition for you guys, as a thank you for your support</p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="text-indent: 0em;">You guys have loved every post we do in relation to Air Max 97’s and they’re one of the pairs of trainers everyone has been talking about this year so it’s only right that they’re the prize of our competition.</span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;">To enter all you need to do is like this picture below on Instagram, tag two of your friends with your shoe size and make sure you are following us on Instagram. Simple right, for a whole pair of 97’s. The winner will be announ<span style="text-indent: 0em;">ced on our Instagram Live Stream where we will put all the contests into a random name picker online and let it pick the lucky winner. Yes it’s a free pair of trainers, legit. Tell a friend to tell a friend, make sure you enter, tell your neighbour and their dog. Thanks for all the support so far, 2018 we’ll do you guys proud a lot more to come.</span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="text-indent: 0em;"> Let us know what you want to see from us !</span></p>
<p style="text-indent: 0px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; font-size: 13px; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: 13px;"><a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/BbU9XjYBFCE/?taken-by=creppluguk"><img class="wp-image-3250 alignleft" style="font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center;" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/air-max-97-BLACKWHITEww-1-300x300.jpg" alt="" width="370" height="376" /></a></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 10pt;"><strong>FREE GIVEAWAY! Win a pair of Nike Air Max 97 Black/White/Black</strong></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 10pt;"><strong>To Enter the Competition:</strong></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 10pt;"><strong>1. Follow us on our Instagram <a class="twitter-atreply pretty-link js-nav" dir="ltr" href="https://www.instagram.com/creppluguk" data-mentioned-user-id="755240945088602112"><s>@</s>creppluguk</a></strong></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 10pt;"><strong>2. Like this photo on our Instagram</strong></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 10pt;"><strong>3. Tag 2 friends in the comments of the Instagram picture with your UK shoe size</strong></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 10pt;"><strong>The competition will close November 17th at 8pm GMT. </strong></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 10pt;"><strong>Winner Announced the next day on our Instagram Live Stream</strong></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 10pt;"><strong>T&amp;C’s you must be from the UK, one entry per person</strong></span></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="font-size: 10pt;"><strong><a class="twitter-hashtag pretty-link js-nav" dir="ltr" href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/crepplug?src=hash" data-query-source="hashtag_click"><s>#</s>crepplug</a></strong></span></p>
<strong>GOOD LUCK !</strong>]]></content:encoded>
