							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Louis Vuitton Names Virgil Abloh as Its New Men’s Wear Designer</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/louis-vuitton-names-virgil-abloh-as-its-new-mens-wear-designer/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 26 Mar 2018 15:21:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=4065</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Virgil Abloh has been named Louis Vuitton's artistic director of Menswear. Abloh has gone from designing album covers for Kanye West to having the most popular collaboration campaign with Nike last year with Off-White  to now being the creative director at Louis Vuitton.

<img class="alignnone wp-image-4067" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/merlin_134786064_2bf23c30-2982-4cbe-a9dc-ae26d73a6342-jumbo-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="950" height="633" />

Virgil Abloh the founder of the street wear label Off-White and a longtime creative director for Kanye West, has been named the next artistic director of men’s wear at Louis Vuitton, which if you didn’t know is one of the oldest, most powerful and presitgous European houses in the luxury business.

He becomes Louis Vuitton’s first African-American artistic director, and one of the few black designers at the top of a French heritage house. Joining the likes of Olivier Rousteing a creative director for Balmain and Ozwald Boateng, from the UK who was the designer for Givenchy men’s wear from 2003 to 2007.

“I feel elated,” Mr. Abloh said via phone on Sunday, adding that he planned to relocate his family to Paris to take the job at the largest brand in the stable of LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton, the world’s largest luxury group. “This opportunity to think through what the next chapter of design and luxury will mean at a brand that represents the pinnacle of luxury was always a goal in my wildest dreams. And to show a younger generation that there is no one way anyone in this kind of position has to look is a fantastically modern spirit in which to start.”

It had been rumoured in the recent months that this would happen, and with the hype which Virgil Abloh has around him now, it’s only right !

Mr. Abloh’s appointment is also a reflection of the increasing interest in of a cross over between the luxury and street wear sectors, which has helped boost global sales of luxury personal goods by 5 percent last year alone to an estimated 263 billion euros, according to a recent study by the global consulting firm Bain &amp; Company.

“Virgil is incredibly good at creating bridges between the classic and the zeitgeist of the moment,” said Michael Burke, chief executive of Louis Vuitton.

Mr. Abloh, 37, a first-generation Ghanaian-American raised in Illinois, is widely considered one of the coolest icons in fashion right now. A man who effortlessly makes the connection between fashion, celebrity lifestyle, music, digital and hype), to recontextualize what’s familiar for the culture.

Virgil had no formal fashion education (his mother was a seamstress and taught him her trade; he studied architecture and civil engineering). Abloh founded Off-White in 2013, almost a decade after he first met Kanye West and became his creative partner.

Now Off-White currently has 3.1 million Instagram followers (Virgil Abloh racking 1.6 million alone), and Mr. Abloh received the Urban Luxe award at the British Fashion Awards last year.

A champion of the cross-branded collaboration, Mr. Abloh has worked with names as varied as Nike, Jimmy Choo, Moncler and, with an upcoming project, Ikea and most recently, he teamed up with <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/27/fashion/virgil-abloh-takashi-murakami-gagosian-gallery.html">Takashi Murakami</a>.

Mr. Abloh will continue to run Off-White — “it is for the 17-year-old version of myself, whereas Vuitton is for the 37-year-old I am today,” he said — and to work with Mr. West. But he said he would cut back on his other activities, including moonlighting as a D.J. He will show his first collection for Louis Vuitton during Paris Men’s Fashion Week in June.

<img class="alignnone wp-image-4068" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/virgil-abloh-louis-vuitton-new-menswear-designer-1-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="950" height="633" />

Are you excited for what Virgil will put out next? Let us know below !

Source : <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/03/26/business/louis-vuitton-virgil-abloh.html">New York Times</a>]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title>Unpacking the Nike Corduroy Collection</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/nikecorduroycollection/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 28 Mar 2018 08:00:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ilaydamc]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=4110</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Nike’s Air Max 95, Air Force 1, and Air Max 97 are all getting a corduroy makeover for a Spring 2018 release. Now, this is all thanks to th<span style="font-size: 10pt;">e hype of Sean</span>

[caption id="attachment_4113" align="alignright" width="192"]<img class="wp-image-4113" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/corduroy-300x200.jpg" alt="" width="192" height="128" /> <span style="font-size: 10pt;">Sean Wotherspoon Air Max 97</span>[/caption]

Wotherspoon’s highly-anticipated Air Max 97 which was released earlier this week; the collaboration came about after the design w<span style="font-size: 10pt;">on the Revolution Air Design Competition.</span>

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

<span style="font-size: 10pt;">The shoe itself is made from corduroy, which is a material infamously used within 70s/80s vintage fashion, as a pose to footwear. This classic fabric, however, has proven to be very popular. Corduroy fabric is very hard-wearing, but also very lightweight making it an ideal material for a Spring/Summer casual shoe. The material is also featured on the</span> inner line as well as the exterior lining, which provides even more comfort than usual. As a result, Nike is utilising this opportunity to capitalise on this new trend, as well as re-birth a trio of classics.

&nbsp;

The show has a warm blue hue, with red, blue and yellow colouring. In addition, the 3M reflective detailing on the Air Max 95 and Air Max 97 as a modern touch. All three pairs feature an all white sole. This retro-themed colorway isn’t a new addition to Nike’s, the collection is reminiscent of the Air Max 97 Finish Line 25<sup>th</sup> anniversary shoe (pictured below).

<img class="size-medium wp-image-4111 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/corduroy1-300x300.png" alt="" width="300" height="300" />

Nike has utilised these classic, fan favourite silhouettes with bright retro colours, a luxe material, and guaranteed comfort, creating an ideal shoe fit with soft tones for the upcoming Spring/Summer seasons. Scroll down to take a look at the full collection and let us know your opinion below.

Stay tuned for update on the exact release date (TBC).

Air Max 95 (Below)

<img class=" wp-image-4119 alignnone" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/corduroy17-300x186.png" alt="" width="343" height="213" /><img class=" wp-image-4120 alignnone" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/corduroy18-300x192.png" alt="" width="353" height="226" />

Air Mac 97 (Below)

<img class="size-medium wp-image-4112 alignnone" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/corduroy2-261x300.png" alt="" width="261" height="300" /><img class=" wp-image-4115 alignnone" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/corduroy13-300x200.png" alt="" width="408" height="272" />

Air Force 1

<img class="size-medium wp-image-4116 alignnone" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/corduroy14-300x280.png" alt="" width="300" height="280" /><img class=" wp-image-4117 alignnone" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/corduroy15-300x186.png" alt="" width="389" height="241" />

Make sure you follow my insta to stay updated on latest posts! (<a href="http://www,instagram.com/ilaydamcntsh">@ilaydamcntsh</a>)]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>The IBEX</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/the-ibex/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 29 Mar 2018 19:30:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[KickinItWithAK]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=3997</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Hey Crep Plug Fam! On behalf of myself and the rest of the Kickin’ It team, whats good? Today, you’re currently <strong>Kickin’ It with AK</strong>. Let’s talk Nike, specifically Air Force 1 – and even more specifically the Mid SFs in Ibex. Not ya average white trainers, I’ll tell you that.

<img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-3999" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/IMG_5827-300x195.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="195" />
<p style="text-align: center;"><em><strong>Nike SF AF1</strong> - Ibex - Urban Soldier</em></p>
The <em>“Urban Soldier”</em> bad boys dropped just in time for the winter season, on November 11<sup>th</sup> 2017, who said white trainers are just for summer, huh? Over here in the UK, the weather doesn’t agree with us much, so around this time there’s a<em>lot </em>of rain and mud with a touch of snow. It’s like these trainers were made to battle that (which it was) – they’re extremely durable! The material around the rear makes these incredibly easy to clean, so don’t panic if you clock a bit of dirt (or if you forget to spray a bit of Crep Protect) these trainers got your back.

Who doesn’t like a bit 3m reflective material and their shoes? You’re in for a shock if you snap a picture of these with flash, with a detailed camo pattern placed across the nylon around the ankle, and “AF1” slapped across it.  There’s even two zips placed at the back to make it easier to wear, which kinda reminds me of Sk8 Hi Reissue Zip....Of course, these have the well known AF1 strap, which is adjustable with a bit of extra detailing.

<strong>Kickin’ It Rating System</strong>

Comfortability: 7/10 - I usually get my Forces half a size down 'cause they usually fit quite snug - these are too snug that they hurt a bit! A fault of my own nonetheless

Durability: 10/10 - <em>Very</em> durable, I wore these out in the snow to test how durable it actually was, and they really proved their worth to me

Follow us on the gram! - <a href="http://www.instagram.com/kickinit.jpg">@kickinit.jpg</a>

<strong>- AK</strong>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>WIN A PAIR OF NIKE AIR MAX 98&#039;S</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/win-a-pair-of-air-max-98s/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 03 Apr 2018 16:43:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=4143</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[So we're back with another giveaway ! We thought it would be the right time for us to give away another pair of trainers for free to our followers. It's 2018, Air Max 98's are popping so its only right we give a pair of Air Max 98's, in white, ready for the summer. Stay tuned for the content we're about to create and ride the wave with us ! Spread the word, #crepplug.
<p style="text-align: left;"><a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/BhCRXdbAif_/?taken-by=creppluguk"><img class=" wp-image-4144 alignleft" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/AM98-300x300.jpg" alt="" width="480" height="480" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/BhCRXdbAif_/?taken-by=creppluguk"><strong>FREE GIVEAWAY! Win a pair of Nike Air Max 98 Triple White </strong>
<strong>To Enter the Competition: </strong>
<strong>1. Follow us </strong></a><strong><a class="notranslate" href="https://www.instagram.com/creppluguk/">@creppluguk</a><a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/BhCRXdbAif_/?taken-by=creppluguk">
2. Like this photo
3. Tag 3 friends in the comments and your UK shoe size.
The competition will close April 9th at 8pm GMT.
Winner Announced the next day on our Instagram
T&amp;C's you must be from the UK, one entry per person, should also be available to collect the pair personally from London !
</a><a href="https://www.instagram.com/explore/tags/crepplug/">#crepplug</a></strong></p>]]></content:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Chune - the Social Music App You&#039;ve Always Desired.</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/chune-the-social-music-app-youve-always-desired/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 04 Apr 2018 19:00:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[senseimel]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=4152</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-4154" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Image-1-1-300x300.png" alt="" width="300" height="300" /><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-4153" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Image-1-169x300.png" alt="" width="169" height="300" />
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p3">CHUNE is a social media music app that connects people through the music they listen to. Users log in with their Apple Music or Spotify accounts and the app will then connect them with people who have listened to the same songs. Users can then interact with one another by following other users with similar tastes in music, sending music to other users or chatting to other users. And I've got the latest scoop direct from the owners mouth for you guys.</p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p1"><strong>Hey, so before we get into the nitty gritty I’m sure our readers would love to know more about the man behind the idea. So tell us a little about yourself?</strong></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p3">Hi, my name is Joshua I’m a university dropout with a passion for all things creative. I’m a Visual Designer and Animator and I’ve been in love with tech ever since Steve Jobs announced the first keynote for the iPhone. I’m a secound generation immigrant from Nigeria and I’ve had that entrepreneurial flair and hard work culture since I was a little boy. I was that one kid selling lucozades in the summer on the playground. I was pretty good at it too at my peak I was making about £40 a day. I’m just trying to make a positive difference in the best way I know how.<span class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-Apple-converted-space"> </span></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p1"><strong>Great stuff, so I’m interested in how the idea for the Chune App came about. Could you tell us about your thought process?</strong></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p3">So the idea for CHUNE came from a very healthy addiction to music. I started to get very frustrated with my music provider Spotify because it felt so closed off from everyone else. Remember the days when you would share music via Bluetooth with your friends? Ever since the big boys have jumped into the market (Apple music, Spotify) etc music has lost that social aspect. I’ve always had the best suggestions for music from friends and family so I decided to build a music app around the people and for the people. Allowing users to interact with like-minded people through the music they listen to.</p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p1"><strong>So this might be a challenge but I want you to describe the Chune App in 3 words.</strong></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p3">Simple, Sexy, Social<span class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-Apple-converted-space"> </span></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p1"><strong>What would you like to achieve from the app as the founder? And what would you like downloaders of the app to gain from it?<span class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-Apple-converted-space"> </span></strong></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p3">As a founder I want to create change and shake up the industry. I want to introduce new ways of thinking in both the tech and music industry and users to experience music in new and exciting ways. For people to open up their music libraries and connect with other people and find new music and experiences.</p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p1"><strong>I’ve learned the app is surrounded around music in particular, the users’ tastes. So which artists are currently in your rotation?</strong></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p3">I’m a massive hip-hop fan cliche right? - I’ve recently found this new boy band called BROCKHAMPTON I’m really feeling everything they’ve put out. Kendrick Lamar doesn’t know it but I’m his long lost forgotten son. To throw a spanner in the works I also like Indie bands like Tame Impala and Foster The People.<span class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-Apple-converted-space"> </span></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p1"><strong>Do you believe that there’s any scope for this to become bigger than bringing people with the same music tastes together. For example, bridging artists promotion teams to fans directly or something similar?</strong></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p3">CHUNE will one day allow verified accounts to join the platform. This will give artists a totally new way to connect with their fans. Users can follow their favourite artists and experience and listen to music in sync with them. This means that one day artists and influencers will be able to essential DJ for anybody who is listening to their channel on CHUNE in real-time. This new bridge will totally reshape how artists promote their music to their fans. CHUNE is essentially trying to create a direct to consumer channel for artists, promotion teams and influencers.<span class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-Apple-converted-space"> </span></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p1"><strong>Is Chune targeted to a certain age demographic? If not, how will you make sure that is a must-download for people of all ages?<span class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-Apple-converted-space"> </span></strong></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p3">The beautiful thing about music is that it is connected to everyone. For this reason CHUNE doesn’t really have a targeted demographic anyone and everybody can use it. Obviously because of it’s social aspect I’ll be targeting millennials predominately. We are confident in the platform and it’s value propositions we hope for it to grow organically through word of mouth. The platform will only get better the more people that join and share content so we are working very hard now to market the same to as many demographics as possible.<span class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-Apple-converted-space"> </span></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p1"><strong>What do you find are the most advantageous ways of promotion in the field your app is in?<span class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-Apple-converted-space"> </span></strong></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p3">Social media is a big thing because the most influential people in the world use it. I’ve been working hard to engage my audience through my social accounts. We released visuals of the app for the first time last week and it got an amazing reception. We have found that just speaking to our fans on socials increases engagement and brand awareness. Video is also a great tool to show people the ins and outs of the app. We will be releasing video content up until launch to give out fans sneak peaks at the features we have in store for them.</p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p1"><strong>And finally to close a very informative interview, thus far as a black male in an industry that not many of your peers are in, do you feel any increased pressure to succeed? And how has this affected your work?</strong></p>
<p class="m_2138854366208662931gmail-p3">Being a black man in todays society is obviously a challenge. I never let this define me times are changing and opportunities are arising for ethnic minorities. I don’t feel added pressure to succeed I actually feel an amazing amount of the support in my community which pushes me to work harder. Also working in the creative industry is pretty sweet it’s a level playing field because great content and talent will always rise to the top regardless of race, gender or sexual orientation.</p>
<strong>Thanks for taking the time to answer my questions. So that's it, all you need to know about CHUNE and its founder. Follow the app on twitter @<a href="https://twitter.com/Chune_App">CHUNE_App</a> and Joshua @<a href="https://twitter.com/jayoguntino">jayoguntino</a> for more updates. </strong>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_metadesc]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[CHUNE is a social media music app that connects people through the music they listen to. Users log in with their Apple Music or Spotify accounts and the app will then connect them with people who have listened to the same songs.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_linkdex]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[78]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_content_score]]></wp:meta_key>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>Skepta&#039;s Nike Collab Could Be Dropping Next Month #SkAIR 2</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/skepta-nike-collab-could-be-dropping-next-month-skair-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Apr 2018 19:16:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=4235</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The #SkAir drop last September was very successful for Skepta and it was a release that had the streets buzzing. Skepta the grime powerhouse has continued to go from strength to strength as he does every year, and since the drop has accomplished more greatness. He featured on the cover of GQ wearing his new underwear line as part of his MAINS fashion collection alongside Naomi Campbell, just to name one of his many power moves.

Skepta will soon bring his own flavour to a new Nike hybrid runner.

According to Twitter's <a href="https://twitter.com/py_rates/status/950840829232472064" target="_blank" rel="noopener">py_rates</a>, the next collaboration will be the Air Max 97/BW, a fused runner that pairs the upper of the Air Max Classic BW together with the tooling of the Air Max 97. The Air Max Classic BW silhoutte is one which hasn't been particularly popular in recent years so it will be great to see its potential resurgence.

The model hasn't officially been unveiled, but py_rates shared a rendering in the classic "Persian Violet" colorway earlier this week. Based on the color description, Skepta's summertime make-up appears to be white-based, with purple accents.
<figure class="image"><a href="http://images.solecollector.com/complex/images/fl_lossy,q_auto/c_crop,h_580,w_1080,x_0,y_186/c_scale,w_800/v1/mlqr44def5mjgfh7bj30/nike-air-max-97-bw" target="_self"><img src="http://images.solecollector.com/complex/images/fl_lossy,q_auto/c_crop,h_580,w_1080,x_0,y_186/c_scale,w_800/v1/mlqr44def5mjgfh7bj30/nike-air-max-97-bw" alt="nike-air-max-97-bw" /></a></figure>
Skepta's upcoming Nike Air Max 97/BW hybrid sneaker is rumored to be hitting retailers next month.

&nbsp;
<p style="text-align: center;">https://twitter.com/Skepta/status/966693357551587328?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw&amp;ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fsolecollector.com%2Fnews%2F2018%2F04%2Fskepta-nike-air-max-97-bw-release-date-ao2113-100</p>
So we now have new updates on the SkAir pair dropping next month.

<img class="wp-image-4265 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/nike-air-max-97-bw-skepta-white-blue-ao2113-100-300x211.jpg" alt="" width="1321" height="929" />

Skepta’s next Nike Air Max collaboration will once again bridge the gap between two key Air Max silhouettes of the 1990s. This time around, his design goes true sole-swap hybrid style as it features the upper of the Air Classic BW with the full-length Air Unit of the 97 model. Additionally, the mesh upper features the honeycomb-style pattern from the Air Tuned 99, a visual/material cue taken from the UK-based grime artist’s last collaboration with Nike. Finally, this <a href="http://sneakernews.com/tag/nike-air-max-97/">Air Max 97</a>/BW features alternate colors on Swoosh and Air Unit – blue on the left and red on the right. While a release date is not yet known, <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/BiBJoL-llWT/?taken-by=atmos_tokyo">atmos</a>reports a release date of May 9th.

<img class="size-medium wp-image-4266 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/skepta-nike-air-max-97-bw-1-300x210.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="210" /> <img class="size-medium wp-image-4267 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/skepta-nike-air-max-97-bw-2-300x280.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="280" /> <img class="size-medium wp-image-4268 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/skepta-nike-air-max-97-bw-3-1-262x300.jpg" alt="" width="262" height="300" /> <img class="size-medium wp-image-4269 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/skepta-nike-air-max-97-bw-3-262x300.jpg" alt="" width="262" height="300" />

&nbsp;

We now have the official release for these 19.05.2018

You can enter the raffle to buy them <strong><a href="https://www.thedropdate.com/releases/nike-x-skepta-air-max-97-bw-ao2113-100"><em>here</em></a></strong> at <strong><a href="https://blog.endclothing.com/nike-x-skepta-air-max-97bw-register-now-on-end-launches/"><em>END</em></a></strong>.

Click this link <a href="https://www.thedropdate.com/releases/nike-x-skepta-air-max-97-bw-ao2113-100"><em>here</em> </a>to find out what retailers you will be able to purchase these from on the 19th !

Let us know what you think of them

Follow us on Instagram to stay updated <a href="http://www.instagram.com/creppluguk">@creppluguk</a>
<p style="text-align: left;">Sources : <a href="https://solecollector.com/news/2018/04/skepta-nike-air-max-97-bw-release-date-ao2113-100">Solecollector &amp;</a> <a href="https://sneakernews.com/2018/04/25/skepta-nike-air-max-97-bw/">Sneakernews </a></p>]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1587054854]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title>&#039;OFF THE WALL’ Since ‘66</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/off-the-wall-since-66/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Apr 2018 09:00:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ilaydamc]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=4245</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The Van Doren Rubber Company launched in Anaheim, California in 1966 by brothers Paul and Jim Van Doren. The first pair released was the notorious ‘The Authentic’ #44 Deck Shoes. Their rugged style, and rubber soul made them the ideal shoe for skateboarders in the early 70s. It wasn’t until 1976, that The Vans Doren Rubber Company, debuted the Vans ‘Off the Wall’ brand. Many pairs were successful during this period, but the Vans Classic Slip-Ons became internationally popular, following their feature in the film <em>Fast Times at Ridgemont High, </em>starring Sean Penn.

[caption id="attachment_4246" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<img class="wp-image-4246 size-medium" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/slip-ons-300x300.jpeg" alt="" width="300" height="300" /> <span style="font-size: 8pt">Vans Classic Slip-Ons </span>[/caption]

In 1996, Vans launched a long term partnership with Supreme, with a series of co-branded Old Skools. The Old Skools are still one of the most versatile and popular shoe in current street fashion. Across the 00s, Vans further integrated themselves as a brand within skateboarding, BMX, and even snowboarding sub-cultures. In addition to this, Vans branched out through collaborations with the Beatles, Metallica, Odd Future, Supreme and most expensively, Fear of God Era 95.

[caption id="attachment_4248" align="aligncenter" width="300"]<img class="wp-image-4248 size-medium" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/old-skools-300x225.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="225" /> <span style="font-size: 8pt">Notorious Vans Old Skools</span>[/caption]

Earlier this month, I attended Vans’ ‘Make it Yourself’ event in collaboration with ASOS. This event was hosted in the iconic House of Vans space in Waterloo, London. Throughout the day a series of talks and workshops took place, all within the realm of creative expression through art, music, skateboarding, street culture and fashion. The venue itself has 30,000 square feet of transformed space. It used to be home to the Old Vic Tunnels but has now become a Skatepark, and hub which encapsulates the influence of skate culture on fashion.

<img class="size-medium wp-image-4252 alignnone" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/IMG_0981-300x300.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="300" /><img class="size-medium wp-image-4253 alignnone" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/IMG_0982-274x300.jpg" alt="" width="274" height="300" /><img class="size-medium wp-image-4251 alignnone" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/IMG_0980-267x300.jpg" alt="" width="267" height="300" />

Within the tunnels Joshua Osbourne’s Looped commissioned photo series was displayed, alongside aesthetically fitting live projections, the evolution of the Vans image as well as showcasing upcoming collaborative projects. Following the daytime events, there were a number of live performances from some of the UK’s rising talents: including Not3s, Tiana Major9 and House of Pharoahs. It is rare to see a brand as global and successful as Vans embrace the creative industries and their consumers in the way this event did. On top of this, to embrace and showcase of London’s up and coming musical talents instead of mainstream talents was very refreshing.

House of Vans is open four days a week, and hosts many major live events on weekends. The venue offers a wide range of cultural and sporting events, as well as many education and learning activities, varying from Girls Skate Night’s to Cinema Nights. Be sure to check out their site for more details!

https://houseofvanslondon.com/

&nbsp;

IG: ilaydamcntsh]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title>The Inflation of Sneaker Prices</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/the-inflation-of-sneaker-prices/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 Jul 2018 10:35:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[crepcheckmondays]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=4508</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">Gather round, this is one we've been sitting on for a while, so sit back &amp; relax. </span></p>
<p class="font_7"></p>
<p class="font_7"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-4510 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/mn-300x259.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="259" /></p>
<p class="font_7"></p>
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">You don't have to be a 'sneakerhead' to have noticed that the prices of sneakers have been increasing dramatically over the years. No doubt the growth of the sneaker community and emergence of 'Hypebeasts' on social media platforms is partially the reason why. But the question is are we getting what we pay for?</span></p>
<p class="font_7"></p>
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">Production Cost - Materials &amp; Markup Prices</span></p>
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">Something plenty of us overlook when we buy a new pair of sneakers. As a customer the last thing your thinking about is how much it cost to make. It's also essentially what plenty of brands want us to overlook but unfortunately, we won't be doing that today. When you compare the production cost compared to the retail price you can see an increase of at least 50-60% with tax excluded, some sneakers even have a markup price over 100%. Courtesy of </span><a href="https://www.highsnobiety.com/2016/05/27/sneaker-production-costs/" target="_blank" rel="noopener undefined" data-content="https://www.highsnobiety.com/2016/05/27/sneaker-production-costs/" data-type="external">Highsnobiety</a><span class="color_2"> we can see that the retail cost for the </span><a href="https://sneakernews.com/2016/06/06/heres-adidas-yeezy-boost-750-greygum-looks-like-feet/" target="_blank" rel="noopener undefined" data-content="https://sneakernews.com/2016/06/06/heres-adidas-yeezy-boost-750-greygum-looks-like-feet/" data-type="external">Yeezy Boost 750 Grey Gum</a><span class="color_2"> was $350 (£265) and the production cost $76 (£57). The markup price is just over four times the production cost. The </span><a href="https://thesolesupplier.co.uk/release-dates/nike/nike-air-max-2016-black/" target="_blank" rel="noopener undefined" data-content="https://thesolesupplier.co.uk/release-dates/nike/nike-air-max-2016-black/" data-type="external">Nike Air Max 2016</a><span class="color_2"> presents a similar story, the markup price will throw you for such a basic sneaker. The production cost sits at only $33 (£25), whereas the retail price is $190 (£144), with a markup price close to 600 percent. So we ask again, are we getting what we pay for?</span></p>
<img class=" wp-image-4513 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/giphy.gif" alt="" width="512" height="211" />
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">Competition</span></p>
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">Let's look at the two brands leading the sneaker market, Nike and Adidas. They can be compared to the likes of Apple vs Samsung, one is the clear leader and the other disregarded. In 2017 Nike's revenue was $34.350 billion dollars and the revenue for adidas in 2017 was $26.309 billion dollars. So what is the cause of this separation between these two brands? Are Adidas not producing the sneakers we want or have Nike finessed both their market and customer research to identify their unique selling point to know exactly what customers want? All you have to do is look at Nike's releases over the last six months to see what sets these two powerhouses apart. The sudden demand for the re-emergence of the Air Max <a href="https://thesolesupplier.co.uk/release-dates/nike/air-max-98/" target="_blank" rel="noopener undefined" data-content="https://thesolesupplier.co.uk/release-dates/nike/air-max-98/" data-type="external">98, new</a> Air Max <a href="https://thesolesupplier.co.uk/release-dates/nike/air-max-97/" target="_blank" rel="noopener undefined" data-content="https://thesolesupplier.co.uk/release-dates/nike/air-max-97/" data-type="external">97</a> and <a href="https://thesolesupplier.co.uk/release-dates/nike/tn-air-max-plus/" target="_blank" rel="noopener undefined" data-content="https://thesolesupplier.co.uk/release-dates/nike/tn-air-max-plus/" data-type="external">Air Max Plus</a> colourways, the Hybrids - Air <a href="https://thesolesupplier.co.uk/release-dates/nike/air-vapormax-plus/" target="_blank" rel="noopener undefined" data-content="https://thesolesupplier.co.uk/release-dates/nike/air-vapormax-plus/" data-type="external">VaporMax Plus</a>, </span><a href="https://sneakernews.com/2018/05/08/nike-air-max-97-plus-release-info/" target="_blank" rel="noopener undefined" data-content="https://sneakernews.com/2018/05/08/nike-air-max-97-plus-release-info/" data-type="external"><span class="color_2">Air Max Plus 97</span></a><span class="color_2">, </span><a href="https://sneakernews.com/2018/05/08/nike-air-max-97-plus-release-info/" target="_blank" rel="noopener undefined" data-content="https://sneakernews.com/2018/05/08/nike-air-max-97-plus-release-info/" data-type="external"><span class="color_2">Air Max 97 Plus and many more contributing factors.</span></a><span class="color_2"> Don't get us wrong we love a Stan Smith, an NMD,  an Ultra Boost, a Superstar and a Yeezy. But, what is stopping Adidas from keeping up with Nike? Could it be their lower prices and the amount that they sell or how the brand is being presented? How can Adidas catch up?</span></p>
<p class="font_7"></p>
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">Influence - Sponsorships </span></p>
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">Celebrities, influencers, and athletes all over the globe and on social media platforms will eventually end up representing a brand or being sponsored by them. Take LeBron James for example, a basketball player sponsored by Nike. His popularity and how well LeBron plays may push someone to cop a pair of LeBron's to ball in, because they feel like they'll be able to emulate his level of performance in them. The </span>LeBron 15<span class="color_2"> costs $185 (£140) and that's no coincidence, because we have Paul George a less popular and talented player than LeBron James with his very own </span><a href="https://www.nike.com/gb/t/pg-2-basketball-shoe-3hDKcr/AJ2039-400?cp=euns_kw_pla%21uk%21goo%21pla%21c%21%21%21209400107455&amp;gclid=CjwKCAjw9qfZBRA5EiwAiq0AbQtt-GkqMG9T6oUl8ETj0SIlLPtEpvnsIOi5OYk4aw3DUnuZMLVfIBoCIbMQAvD_BwE&amp;gclsrc=aw.ds" target="_blank" rel="noopener undefined" data-content="https://www.nike.com/gb/t/pg-2-basketball-shoe-3hDKcr/AJ2039-400?cp=euns_kw_pla%21uk%21goo%21pla%21c%21%21%21209400107455&amp;gclid=CjwKCAjw9qfZBRA5EiwAiq0AbQtt-GkqMG9T6oUl8ETj0SIlLPtEpvnsIOi5OYk4aw3DUnuZMLVfIBoCIbMQAvD_BwE&amp;gclsrc=aw.ds" data-type="external">PG 2</a><span class="color_2"> priced at $126 (£95). The whole point of sponsorships is to bring more profit to any brand, more traffic to their website to help them stay ahead and continue to forge a gap between them &amp; their competitors. </span></p>
<img class=" wp-image-4514 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/giphy-1-300x168.gif" alt="" width="483" height="270" />
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">Collaborations</span></p>
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">Collaborations also contribute to the inflation of sneaker prices, and what brand have been snatching up the hottest collabs over the last six months? Nike. When one premium brand collaborates with another, you should automatically expect high prices. From Supreme, Off-White, Kith all the way to the Comme des Garcons. These collaborations are usually exclusive and a limited amount of units are available, but due to the hype surrounding news of the release we all swallow it up and rush to cop them without glancing at the price or taking a detailed look at the sneakers. Do we actually like the sneakers and want them or just want them for reselling purposes? As said in previous posts, we will be touching on reselling and everything raffles and bots in an upcoming blog.</span></p>
<p class="font_7"></p>
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">To close, as consumers we understand that brands want &amp; have to make a profit to continue to be successful, which is obviously gained through pricing. So, if they're going to try to 'finesse' and make a profit from consumers give us; quality, durability, a reason why we should buy from you instead of another brand. Simple justification for why we should spend X amount on your products. Whether it be in the form of materials that are being used or designs that are released. Help us find a reason that justifies your prices.</span></p>
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">We'd love to hear your thoughts and opinions on this, have we missed any key points? Let us know below!</span></p>
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">Subscribe to keep up to date with us and head over to our Instagram <a href="https://www.instagram.com/crepcheckmondays/" target="_blank" rel="noopener undefined" data-content="https://www.instagram.com/crepcheckmondays/" data-type="external">@crepcheckmondays</a> to get your daily sneaker fix.</span></p>
<p class="font_7"><span class="color_2">Stay wavy!</span></p>
Check out the original post <em><a href="https://www.crepcheckmondays.com/single-post/2018/06/14/The-Inflation-of-Sneaker-Prices-CREP-TALK-7">here</a></em>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title>Crepplug Styles: Fashion Inspo</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/crepplug-styles-fashion-inspo/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 05 Aug 2018 22:12:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[estaaxo]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=4583</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="text-decoration: underline; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><b>Sherlinanym:</b></span></p>
&nbsp;
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Fashion icon Sherlinanym has been one to look after for the last few years since she made her fashionable debut in 2009 on Tumblr before making her way to Instagram where she has gained 1.3 Million followers who look to her for the latest releases.</span></p>
&nbsp;
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><img class="size-medium wp-image-4586 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/IMG_2690-266x300.jpg" alt="" width="266" height="300" /></span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">This July she designed her own pair of 97’s which are available to purchase from @badkicksclub on instagram. This new pair has caught the attention of many of her followers because of the vibrant yellow feature it has.</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">I’m very optimistic that in the near future we can surely expect more shoes from Sherlina.</span></p>
&nbsp;

&nbsp;
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><img class="size-medium wp-image-4588 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/IMG_2694-262x300.jpg" alt="" width="262" height="300" /></span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Here she showcased the recently released PUMAxMCM in June which is an excellent collaboration from both brands. This can be easily styled with many neutral and bright colours to compliment the white and grey tone of the shoe.</span></p>
&nbsp;

<span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><img class="size-medium wp-image-4589 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/IMG_2695-260x300.jpg" alt="" width="260" height="300" /></span>
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Again our girl Sherlina styled this orange pair of balenciaga’s with a cropped orange denim jacket with a pair of ripped denim to complement the design of the shoe.</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Sherlina shows through her style that adding colour to your wardrobe is okay, this can be seen in her exceptional collection of colourful trainers collection.</span></p>
<span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><img class="size-medium wp-image-4590 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/IMG_2696-267x300.jpg" alt="" width="267" height="300" /></span>
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Here she showcased one of the re-released Nike Air 98’s which as you can see if different to the 95’s &amp; 97’s in its appearance which has many creative features to it looks.</span></p>
&nbsp;
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><img class="size-medium wp-image-4587 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/IMG_2692-266x300.jpg" alt="" width="266" height="300" /></span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Here she posted the fiery red Nike Air 270 released in June. A very likeable pair from the 270 collection.</span></p>
&nbsp;
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Sherlinanym is a rising fashion influencer who not only has been known to create new trends but showcase many admirable style choices.</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">Her growth is expanding each day, as she continues to inspire many people in their sense of style &amp; in their choice of trainers.</span></p>
&nbsp;
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;">‘’<b>Comment below which trainers from Sherlina's collection you like best</b>’’</span></p>
&nbsp;
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"><b>- estaaxo</b></span></p>
&nbsp;
<p style="margin: 0px; font-size: 12px; line-height: normal; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; color: #454545;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif;">Follow <a href="https://www.instagram.com/estaaxo/">@estaaxo</a> on Instagram</span></p>

<div></div>]]></content:encoded>

					<item>
		<title>Skeptas Back It&#039;s #SkAir Time Again</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/skeptas-back-its-skair-time-again/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Aug 2018 22:54:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=4623</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Early last week it was revealed that Skepta has a baby on the way, a new member of the Adenuga family, a BBK baby ! So congratulations to the big man himself Skepta, but anyway back to why you're here #SkAir.

<img class="wp-image-4624 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/skepta-air-max-london-300x165.jpg" alt="" width="680" height="374" />

The first #SkAir drop last year was a huge success and it was shortly followed up by a second Skepta x Nike collaboration within a year, just a few months ago. And now we're on to the next one. There had been rumours of potentially a third collaboration and images were leaked here and there but no real substance was revealed until now.

<img class=" wp-image-4629 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/skepta-nike-air-max-971bw-release-price-000-300x180.jpg" alt="" width="678" height="408" />

Skepta took to Instagram to tease his new collab. A fuzzy video clip uploaded showcases his next Air Max Deluxe sneaker, revealing new 3M detailing and his ever present “SK Air” logo.

In the clip we see “NEVER SLEEP ON TOUR” and “12:05 PM JUNE 08 2014” , which marks the release date of the track "That's Not Me", a very important track in the recent history of grime.

https://www.instagram.com/p/BmJxO0EH8fk/?taken-by=hypebeastkicks

Are you excited ?

Let us know, follow our page to stay updated and for news on its official release date !

Source : <a href="https://versus.uk.com/2018/08/looks-like-skeptas-nike-skairs-getting-restock/">Versus</a>]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[<blockquote class="instagram-media" data-instgrm-captioned data-instgrm-permalink="https://www.instagram.com/p/BmJxO0EH8fk/?utm_source=ig_embed&amp;utm_medium=loading" 							</item>
					<item>
		<title>ASTROWORLD: 2 Weeks After the Re-opening...</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/astroworld-2-weeks-after-the-re-opening/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Aug 2018 19:00:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[senseimel]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=4711</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Travis Scott released his 3<sup>rd</sup> studio album <em>ASTROWORLD</em> just under 2 weeks ago. Now the dust (and hype) has settled slightly and I have lived with the album, I thought it would be a good time to review the Houston-born rapper's<span style="text-indent: 0em;"> newest project.</span>

The album starts on a high note, <em>STARGAZING</em> this has been claimed as one of the standout tracks from the album. I think it sets the tone for what can only be described as an unpredictable journey through Travis’ planet home of <em>ASTROWORLD</em>. We hear this when the beat changes 3 minutes into the track. This is followed by <em>CAROUSEL</em> which is accompanied by vocals from the legendary Frank Ocean, this is the start of nearly 20 impeccably positioned features on the album. <em>Sprinkling methamphetamines on the leaves like the snow</em>. There’s no denying the heavy amount of drug references in <em>ASTROWORLD</em> but what I think is cool is the fact they are so subtly and beautifully incorporated that they don’t become the take-home message from the album.

<em>Sun is down freezin’ cold That’s how we already know winter’s here</em>, in the first couple of bars Travis employs Drake to tell us the album is going to take a bit of a darker turn, which is evident in <em>R.I.P.</em> SCREW and <em>STOP TRYING TO BE GOD</em>. This is one of my top 3 songs on the album. <em>SICKO MODE</em> encapsulates what I love about all 3 artists on the track; Drake’s ability to produce some cold flows, Travis’ catchy lyrics and Swae Lee’s beautiful eerie vocals. But I do I feel like we need Drake to release an extended version of his first verse.

<img class="size-full wp-image-4712 aligncenter" src="https://crepplug.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/travis-astroworld.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="300" />

Another favourite of mine is <em>WAKE UP</em>, from the guitar chords in the intro to the Weeknd’s endearing vocals on the chorus. Now I must say ever since the Weeknd’s split from his ex Selena Gomez he has been producing some real credible work from <em>My Dear Melancholy</em> to his features. This song just has it all for me a great mellow beat, catchy chorus and a perfect balance of vocals to rap.

<em>YOSEMITE</em> would have been in my top 3 as it was an absolute pleasure to listen to Travis and Gunna trading bars however, Nav’s poorly engineered verse just pushes it out for me. Please, as an artist ensure you have a good mix engineer working for you it could really cost you. <em>I might need me some ventilation A little vacation, HOUSTONFORNICATION, </em>one of six songs with no collaborators. For me <em>HOUSTONFORNICATION</em> sounded like the Travis I really love all the elements that make Travis…Travis were in this track. Sevn Thomas and Wallis Lane also did an amazing job with the production, this track is elite tier Travis in my opinion.

So that’s it, after letting <em>ASTROWORLD</em> marinate I can honestly say it is one of my favourite albums to be released this year. I feel overall it is very cohesive and feels like a project that has not been rushed but rather worked on for a long time. From the perfectly positioned features, to the great variety of beats; this is definitely an album Travis Scott should be proud of.

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>FREE GIVEAWAY! Win a pair of Nike Tuned 1&#039;s</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/free-giveaway-win-a-pair-of-nike-tuned-1s/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Aug 2018 23:54:34 +0000</pubDate>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We hit 10,000+ followers on our Instagram page so we thought it's only right that we run a competition for our CrepPlug family!

To enter all you need to do is like this picture below on Instagram, tag two of your friends with your shoe size and make sure you are following us on Instagram. Simple right, for a whole pair of Tns. Tell a friend to tell a friend, make sure you enter, tell your neighbour and their dog.

Let us know what else you want to see from us !

https://www.instagram.com/p/BmytJRJhw9q/?taken-by=creppluguk
<p style="text-align: left;"><strong>FREE GIVEAWAY! Win a pair of Nike Tuned 1's 'Tns' in Black</strong>
<strong>To ENTER the Competition: </strong></p>
<strong>1. Follow us <a href="https://www.instagram.com/creppluguk/">@creppluguk </a></strong>
<strong>2. Like this <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/BmytJRJhw9q/?taken-by=creppluguk">photo </a></strong>

		<description></description>

					<item>
		<title>COLOURS Ft. Mace Studios</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/colours-ft-mace-studios/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Sep 2019 16:00:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=6240</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:tadv/classic-paragraph -->
<p>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wn1FYFn5cpA&nbsp;</p>
<p>The first instalment of our new series, where we showcase how different pieces of footwear can be styled with a variety of garments in unique ways. This issue featured Mace Studios with a theme consisting of colours in aligning with the season of summer.</p>
<p>A selection of crep from Jordan the UNC’s to the Puma Thunder Spectras styled in different ways. Let us know what was the best fit or pair of crep.</p>
<p>Shot &amp; Edited By : RDC @rdcvis10ns</p>
<p>Shop the Mace range : www.instagram.com/macestudios</p>
<!-- /wp:tadv/classic-paragraph -->

<!-- wp:tadv/classic-paragraph /-->

					<item>
		<title>BOTH Ft. MAINGRL</title>
		<link>https://shop.crepplug.com/both-ft-maingrl/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Dec 2019 17:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[joao]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://crepplug.com/?p=11197</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:tadv/classic-paragraph -->
<p>Both ft. MAINGRL&nbsp;<br>The second chapter of our series where we shed light on different sneaker picks, outfits/styles and inspirations for these choices. <br><br>This issue features MAIN GRL, an upcoming streetwear brand dedicated to woman empowerment. A selection of pieces styled in this issue from Converse “Seek Peace” to the well known North Face puffer&nbsp;</p>
<p>Shot By : RDC <a href="https://www.instagram.com/rdcvis10ns/">@rdcvis10ns</a> &amp; <a href="https://www.instagram.com/jodykindoki/">@jodykindoki</a>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Shop the Main GRL range : <a href="https://shopmaingrl.com/">www.shopmaingrl.com</a></p>
<!-- /wp:tadv/classic-paragraph -->

<!-- wp:html /-->

<!-- wp:tadv/classic-paragraph /-->
